body.p: The user may practice word inflection in a systematic way - either with singleton words or words in sentences, in order to learn the context in which to use the wordforms.

ul.li: - Parts of speech, see details further down.
- Stem type: bisyllabic, trisyllabic or contracted stems, or all of them.
- The student can get the Norwegian translation by clicking the word she/he does not understand.
- Help: When the student makes mistakes, she/he can be instructed about correct inflection.

body.p: The user may choose what part of speech to work with; nouns, adjectives, verbs or numerals.

ul.li: - Nouns: nominative plural and other cases. In the other cases, the student will be given base forms in both singular and plural.
- Verbs: present and past indicative, conditional, potential and imperative
- Adjectives: as attribute or predicative in different cases. Also comparison.

- Numerals: inflected in different cases, also as attribute to nouns. Collective numerals and ordinal numerals in different cases. Morfa S - in level 1 there are numerals up to 10, both in singular and plural. In level 2 there are also bigger numerals. In Morfa C there are numerals up to 10, both singular and plural.
